text: I have forgotten to roast the turkey
however thanks to the patented bitman 45
minute roast turkey method I'm going to
save the day watch this
I've done this reliably for years and
the result is a really great bird you
have to take out the backbone for this
you need a good solid not too flexible
boning knife and you cut on either side
of the backbone taking care not to cut
your own self if you get to a joint
where there's a bone just crack through
with the chef's knife the idea here is
to get the surface area of the bird
bigger than it was before then you want
to flatten this thing which means
breaking it open a little bit and then
there we go you want the wings to
protect the breasts a little bit you
want the legs to be more exposed this
gives you a much better shot at having a
breast that's not overcooked while the
thighs are fully cooked and the legs are
protruding so they cook quickly because
they're sort of sticking up in the air
the net result is a very very fast
cooking bird and when I say 45 minutes
I'm serious into a roasting pan I'm
gonna do olive oil butter is good too
obviously some peeled garlic cloves
stuck here and there and the crevices
under the wing and then tarragon or
thyme well you put onions and carrots in
here chestnuts sausage for that matter
whatever you usually use for stuffing
type ingredients salt and pepper this is
gonna go in the oven for 45 minutes it
could be five minutes more or less but
it's gonna be done so this is going
right into the oven now and to show you
that I'm not kidding 45 minutes is the
time and the time is 45 minutes
so I was wrong
35 minutes that's pretty good huh
you have been slaving over unevenly
cooked turkeys that took four hours to
do this is 35 minutes and it's good
Happy Thanksgiving
